intro: Arrowsmithia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular arrowhead, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, glandular hairs on its leaves, which contribute to its common name. Arrowsmithia glandulosa is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
